articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf, Ankika Biswas, Shashwat Chauhan
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes gained on Thursday as investors assessed the latest batch of economic data and as Treasury yields steadied ahead of a key inflation report.
articles.title: Wall St gains as investors digest economic data, Treasury yields steady

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A New York state judge on Thursday rejected a bid by Uber Technologies Inc (UBER.N), DoorDash Inc and Grubhub Inc to block New York City's novel law setting a minimum wage for app-based delivery workers.
articles.title: Uber, DoorDash lose bid to block NYC minimum wage for delivery workers

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: China is manipulating global media through censorship, data harvesting and covert purchases of foreign news outlets, the United States said on Thursday, warning the trend could lead to a "sharp contraction" of global freedom of expression.
articles.title: US accuses China of global media manipulation

articles.author: Amina Niasse
articles.description: Contracts to buy U.S. existing homes fell more than expected in August, tumbling by the most in nearly a year as high mortgage rates erode affordability, according to a survey released on Thursday.
articles.title: U.S. pending home sales fall more than expected in August

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "Fortnite" maker Epic Games is laying off about 830 employees, or 16% of its staff, and divesting online music platform Bandcamp, the company said on Thursday.
articles.title: Epic Games is laying off about 830 employees, divesting Bandcamp

articles.author: Marc Frank
articles.description: Power blackouts in Cuba are expected to increase significantly due to a lack of fuel, officials warned in a nationwide TV broadcast, worsening the country's plight as it deals with food and medicine shortages.
articles.title: Cuba warns of worsening blackouts as fuel crisis bites

articles.author: Macdonald Dzirutwe, Libby George
articles.description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu's lightning-fast reform push after taking office in May sparked hope that his administration would be a business-friendly antidote to mounting economic troubles facing Africa's biggest economy.
articles.title: Analysis: Nigerian reform drive falters, threatening Africa's biggest economy

articles.author: Robin Respaut, Chad Terhune
articles.description: Dawn Heidlebaugh felt trapped in a disturbing pattern while taking Ozempic, the popular drug used to treat diabetes and obesity.
articles.title: Wegovy, other weight-loss drugs scrutinized over reports of suicidal thoughts

articles.author: David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The Democratic-led U.S. Senate forged ahead on Thursday with a bipartisan stopgap funding bill aimed at averting a fourth partial government shutdown in a decade, while the House prepared to vote on partisan Republican spending bills with no chance of becoming law.
articles.title: Shutdown odds grow as Senate, House advance separate spending plans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's Supreme Court heard arguments on Thursday against a law passed by the ruling coalition limiting conditions for any removal of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from office, in the latest showdown among branches of government to grip the nation.
articles.title: Top Israeli court hears challenges to law limiting grounds for PM's removal
